solution: Combine like terms: \(3x + 5x = 8x\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Subtract the like terms: \(7x - 2x = (7 - 2)x = 5x\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine the like terms: \(4x + 2x = (4 + 2)x = 6x\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Subtract the like terms: \(9x - 6x = (9 - 6)x = 3x\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine the like terms: \(5x + 3x = (5 + 3)x = 8x\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine like terms: \(3x - 2x + 4 + 5 = x + 9\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine like terms: \(7y - 3y + 2x + 5x = 4y + 7x\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine like terms: \(10x - 3x - 4 + 6 = 7x + 2\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine like terms: \(8y + 3y - 5 + 10 = 11y + 5\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine like terms: \(6x - 4x + 7 - 10 = 2x - 3\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine like terms: \((3x + 5x) + (2y - 4y) + (-z + 7z) = 8x - 2y + 6z\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Subtract the terms: \((7x - 3x) + (9y - 4y) - 6z = 4x + 5y - 6z\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Subtract the terms: \((-4x + 2x) + (y + 3y) - (8z - 5z) = -2x + 4y - 13z\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine like terms: \((12x - 7x) + (-5y + 2y) + (3z - 9z) = 5x - 3y - 6z\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Subtract the terms: \((10x - 4x) + (15y - y) - (7z + 2z) = 6x + 14y - 9z\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine the like terms: \((15x^2 - 4x^2) + (-9y + 12y) + (4z - 7z) + (-20x + 3x) + (11 - 5)\). This simplifies to: \(11x^2 - 17x + 3y - 3z + 6\)
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Distribute the negative sign and combine like terms: \((12a - 7a) + (-8b - 4b) + (5c + 6c) + (-15 - 10)\). This simplifies to: \(5a - 12b + 11c - 25\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine the like terms: \((20m^2 - 15m^2) + (10n + 25n) + (-6p + 3p) + (8 - 2)\). This simplifies to: \(5m^2 + 35n - 3p + 6\)
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Distribute the negative sign and combine like terms: \((30x - 10x) + (-45y - 5y) + (20z + 15z) + (-10 - 5)\). This simplifies to: \(20x - 50y + 35z - 15\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine the like terms: \((25u^2 + 5u^2) + (-30v + 40v) + (10w - 20w) + (5 - 15)\). This simplifies to: \(30u^2 + 10v - 10w - 10\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine like terms: \(3x + 2x = 5x\), \(\frac{1}{2}y - \frac{5}{3}y = -\frac{3}{6}y - \frac{10}{6}y = -\frac{7}{6}y\), \(-z + 4z = 3z\). Therefore, the simplified expression is \(5x - \frac{7}{6}y + 3z\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine like terms: \(\frac{1}{3}a - 2a = -\frac{5}{3}a\), \(4b + b = 5b\), \(-\frac{3}{7}c + \frac{2}{3}c = -\frac{9}{21}c + \frac{14}{21}c = \frac{5}{21}c\). Hence, the simplified expression is \(-\frac{5}{3}a + 5b + \frac{5}{21}c\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine like terms: \(-5x + 7x = 2x\), \(\frac{4}{5}y - \frac{9}{5}y = -\frac{5}{5}y = -y\), \(6z - 2z = 4z\). Thus, the simplified expression is \(2x - y + 4z\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine like terms: \(\frac{7}{4}m + \frac{1}{4}m = \frac{8}{4}m = 2m\), \(-\frac{2}{3}n + \frac{5}{3}n = \frac{3}{3}n = n\),\(5p - 4p = p\). Therefore, the simplified expression is \(2m + n + p\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Combine like terms: \(2a - 4a = -2a\), \(-\frac{3}{8}b + \frac{5}{8}b = \frac{2}{8}b = \frac{1}{4}b\), \(7c - 2c = 5c\). Thus, the simplified expression is \(-2a + \frac{1}{4}b + 5c\).
sub_topic: Section A - Addition and Subtraction of Algebraic Expressions

solution: To multiply the monomials \(3x\) and \(2x\), multiply the coefficients and add the exponents: \(3 \times 2 = 6\) and \(x^1 \times x^1 = x^{1+1} = x^2\). Thus, the product is \(6x^2\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Multiply the coefficients: \(4 \times 3 = 12\). Then add the exponents of \(y\): \(y^1 \times y^2 = y^{1+2} = y^3\). Therefore, the product is \(12y^3\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: What is the result of \(5z^2 \times z\)?
solution: The coefficients are \(5\) and \(1\), so \(5 \times 1 = 5\). The exponents of \(z\) are \(2\) and \(1\), so \(z^2 \times z^1 = z^{2+1} = z^3\). Thus, the product is \(5z^3\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Multiply the coefficients: \(2 \times 3 = 6\). Add the exponents of \(a\): \(a^2 \times a^3 = a^{2+3} = a^5\). Hence, the product is \(6a^5\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: Find the result of multiplying \(x\) by \(4x^2\).
solution: The coefficient of \(x\) is \(1\), so \(1 \times 4 = 4\). Add the exponents of \(x\): \(x^1 \times x^2 = x^{1+2} = x^3\). Therefore, the product is \(4x^3\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: Multiply the monomial \(3x\) by the binomial \(4x + 5\).
solution: To multiply \(3x\) by the binomial \(4x + 5\), distribute \(3x\) to each term in the binomial: \((3x)(4x) + (3x)(5) = 12x^2 + 15x\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: Find the product of the monomial \(7y\) and the binomial \(2y^2 + 3\).
solution: Multiply \(7y\) by each term in the binomial: \((7y)(2y^2) + (7y)(3) = 14y^3 + 21y\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: What is the result when \(5z\) is multiplied by the binomial \(6z + 4\)?
solution: Distribute \(5z\) across the binomial: \((5z)(6z) + (5z)(4) = 30z^2 + 20z\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: Calculate the product of \(8a\) and the binomial \(a^2 + 7\).
solution: Multiply \(8a\) by each term in the binomial: \((8a)(a^2) + (8a)(7) = 8a^3 + 56a\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: Multiply the monomial \(10b\) by the binomial \(2b + 9\).
solution: To find the product, distribute \(10b\) to each term in the binomial: \((10b)(2b) + (10b)(9) = 20b^2 + 90b\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Using the distributive property, \((3x + 5)(2x - 4) = 3x(2x) + 3x(-4) + 5(2x) + 5(-4)\). This simplifies to \(6x^2 - 12x + 10x - 20\), which further simplifies to \(6x^2 - 2x - 20\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Using the distributive property, \((-7x + 2)(x - 3) = -7x(x) + -7x(-3) + 2(x) + 2(-3)\). This simplifies to \(-7x^2 + 21x + 2x - 6\), which further simplifies to \(-7x^2 + 23x - 6\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Using the distributive property, \((4x - 8)(-3x + 5) = 4x(-3x) + 4x(5) + -8(-3x) + -8(5)\). This simplifies to \(-12x^2 + 20x + 24x - 40\), which further simplifies to \(-12x^2 + 44x - 40\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Using the distributive property, \((5x + 6)(x + 4) = 5x(x) + 5x(4) + 6(x) + 6(4)\). This simplifies to \(5x^2 + 20x + 6x + 24\), which further simplifies to \(5x^2 + 26x + 24\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

solution: Using the distributive property, \((2y - 3)(-4y + 7) = 2y(-4y) + 2y(7) + -3(-4y) + -3(7)\). This simplifies to \(-8y^2 + 14y + 12y - 21\), which further simplifies to \(-8y^2 + 26y - 21\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: Multiply the binomial \((3x + 2)\) by the trinomial \((2x^2 + 4x - 5)\).
solution: Distribute each term of the binomial over the trinomial: \(3x(2x^2 + 4x - 5) + 2(2x^2 + 4x - 5)\). This results in \(6x^3 + 12x^2 - 15x + 4x^2 + 8x - 10\). Combine like terms to get \(6x^3 + 16x^2 - 7x - 10\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: Multiply the binomial \((x - 3)\) by the trinomial \((x^2 + 5x + 6)\).
solution: Distribute each term of the binomial over the trinomial: \(x(x^2 + 5x + 6) - 3(x^2 + 5x + 6)\). This results in \(x^3 + 5x^2 + 6x - 3x^2 - 15x - 18\). Combine like terms to get \(x^3 + 2x^2 - 9x - 18\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: Multiply the binomial \((4y - 1)\) by the trinomial \((3y^2 - 2y + 5)\).
solution: Distribute each term of the binomial over the trinomial: \(4y(3y^2 - 2y + 5) - 1(3y^2 - 2y + 5)\). This results in \(12y^3 - 8y^2 + 20y - 3y^2 + 2y - 5\). Combine like terms to get \(12y^3 - 11y^2 + 22y - 5\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: Multiply the binomial \((2z + 5)\) by the trinomial \((z^2 - z + 3)\).
solution: Distribute each term of the binomial over the trinomial: \(2z(z^2 - z + 3) + 5(z^2 - z + 3)\). This results in \(2z^3 - 2z^2 + 6z + 5z^2 - 5z + 15\). Combine like terms to get \(2z^3 + 3z^2 + z + 15\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: Multiply the binomial \((5x + 4)\) by the trinomial \((x^2 + 3x - 2)\).
solution: Distribute each term of the binomial over the trinomial: \(5x(x^2 + 3x - 2) + 4(x^2 + 3x - 2)\). This results in \(5x^3 + 15x^2 - 10x + 4x^2 + 12x - 8\). Combine like terms to get \(5x^3 + 19x^2 + 2x - 8\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: Multiply the trinomials \((2x^2 + \frac{3}{4}xy - 5y^2)\) and \((xy - \frac{1}{2}y + 3z)\). What is the coefficient of the term \(x^2y\)?
solution: To find the coefficient of the term \(x^2y\), we need to consider the multiplication of \(2x^2\) from the first trinomial with \(-\frac{1}{2}y\) from the second trinomial: \(2x^2 \times -\frac{1}{2}y = -x^2y\). The coefficient is -\(1\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: Multiply the trinomials \((x^2 + 4xy - 7z^2)\) and \((3x - y + 2)\). What is the coefficient of the term \(xy^2\)?
solution: To find the coefficient of \(xy^2\), we need to consider the multiplication of terms that result in \(xy^2\). Multiply the second term, \(4xy\) from the first trinomial with the second term, -\(y\) from the second trinomial to get the coefficient of \(xy^2\): \(4xy \times -y = -4xy^2\). Therefore, the coefficient of \(xy^2\) is -4
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: Multiply the trinomials: \((\frac{2}{5}m^2 - 7mn + n^2)\) and \((3m + n - 5p)\).
solution:
Expanding the given trinomials: \((\frac{2}{5}m^2 - 7mn + n^2)\) and \((3m + n - 5p)\), we distribute each term of the first trinomial to every term in the second trinomial: 
\(\frac{2}{5}m^2 \times 3m = \frac{6}{5}m^3\) 
\(\frac{2}{5}m^2 \times n = \frac{2}{5}m^2n\)
\(\frac{2}{5}m^2 \times (-5p) = -2m^2p\)
\( (-7mn) \times 3m = -21m^2n\) 
\((-7mn) \times n = -7mn^2\) 
\((-7mn) \times (-5p) = 35mnp\) 
\(n^2 \times 3m = 3mn^2\) 
\(n^2 \times n = n^3\)
\(n^2 \times (-5p) = -5n^2p\)
Combine like terms to get: \(\frac{6}{5}m^3 + \frac{2}{5}m^2n - 21m^2n - 7mn^2 + 3mn^2 - 2m^2p + 35mnp + n^3 - 5n^2p = \)
\(\frac{6}{5}m^3 - \frac{103}{5}m^2n - 4mn^2 - 2m^2p + 35mnp + n^3 - 5n^2p\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

description: Multiply the trinomials: \((-3x^2 + \frac{5}{2}xy - y^2)\) and \((2x - y + 4z)\).
solution:
Expanding the given trinomials: \((-3x^2 + \frac{5}{2}xy - y^2)\) and \((2x - y + 4z)\), we distribute each term of the first trinomial to every term in the second trinomial: 
\((-3x^2) \times 2x = -6x^3\) 
\((-3x^2) \times (-y) = 3x^2y\)
\((-3x^2) \times 4z = -12x^2z\)
\(\frac{5}{2}xy \times 2x = 5x^2y\)
\(\frac{5}{2}xy \times (-y) = -\frac{5}{2}xy^2\)
\(\frac{5}{2}xy \times 4z = 10xyz\)
\((-y^2) \times 2x = -2xy^2\)
\((-y^2 \times (-y) = y^3\)
\((-y^2) \times 4z = -4y^2z\)
Combine like terms to get: \(-6x^3 + 3x^2y + 5x^2y - 12x^2z - \frac{5}{2}xy^2 - 2xy^2 +10xyz + y^3 - 4y^2z = \)
\(-6x^3 + 8x^2y - 12x^2z - \frac{9}{2}xy^2 +10xyz + y^3 - 4y^2z\).
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions

solution:
Expanding the given trinomials: \((4a^2 + 3ab - \frac{1}{3}b^2)\) and \((-5a + 2b + 6c)\), we distribute each term of the first trinomial to every term in the second trinomial: 
\(4a^2 \times (-5a) = -20a^3\) 
\(4a^2 \times 2b = 8a^2b\)
\(4a^2 \times 6c = 24a^2c\) 
\(3ab \times (-5a) = -15a^2b\)
\(3ab \times 2b = 6ab^2\)
\(3ab \times 6c = 18abc\)
\(-\frac{1}{3}b^2 \times (-5a) = \frac{5}{3}ab^2\) 
\(-\frac{1}{3}b^2 \times 2b = -\frac{2}{3}b^3\)
\(-\frac{1}{3}b^2 \times 6c = -2b^2c\)
Combine like terms to get: \(-20a^3 + 8a^2b - 15a^2b + 24a^2c + 6ab^2 + \frac{5}{3}ab^2 +18abc - \frac{2}{3}b^3 - 2b^2c = \)
\(-20a^3 - 7a^2b +24a^2c + \frac{23}{3}ab^2 +18abc - \frac{2}{3}b^3 - 2b^2c\)
sub_topic: Section B - Multiplication of Algebraic Expressions
